writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
We wake up in our usual chaos, tangled in a mess of blankets and sheets, with a hint of sunlight peeking through the curtains. I'm the first to stir, nudging Nico with my elbow. He groggily opens one eye, then the other, and gives me a lazy smile. I brush my lips against his, and we share a quick, gentle kiss.

"Morning," I whisper.

"Good morning," Nico mumbles, his voice husky with sleep.

We lie there for a moment, enjoying the quiet morning moments together. But as the seconds tick by, Nico's gaze drifts to the clock on his nightstand. He groans, and I know what's coming.

"Come on, Solace. I'm not getting up today," Nico declares, his voice dripping with dramatic flair.

I chuckle and roll over to face him. "You're not getting out of bed, or you're not getting up?"

Nico shoots me a mock-offended look. "I'm a demigod, for Poseidon's sake! I have the right to sleep in."

I laugh and push him playfully. "You're not even a morning person, Nico. You're a night owl."

He grins, his eyes sparkling with mischief. "That's why I need you to get me coffee."

I throw a pillow at him, and we engage in a playful pillow fight. Our morning banter is a staple of our relationship, a way to wake each other up and start the day on a lighthearted note.

After our battle subsides, we settle down, and I head to the kitchen to make Nico his coffee. As I'm brewing the coffee, Nico strolls in, rubbing the sleep from his eyes.

"Hey, Solace?" he says, his voice a little softer than usual.

"Yeah?"

Nico pauses, his eyes locked on mine. "I was thinking... maybe we could start our day with something a little more... magical."

I raise an eyebrow, intrigued. "What did you have in mind?"

Nico grins, a faraway look in his eyes. "I was thinking we could have a sunrise ritual. You know, something to connect us to our demigod heritage."

My heart skips a beat at the suggestion. I've always loved the way Nico speaks about our shared identity, the way it connects us on a deeper level.

"Okay," I say, my voice barely above a whisper. "I'm in."

Nico's face lights up, and he pulls me into a warm hug. "I knew you'd see it my way, Solace."

We spend the next few minutes planning our ritual, discussing the specifics of what we want to include. It's a mix of old and new, a blend of our demigod heritage and our modern lives.

As the sun rises higher in the sky, we head outside, our hands clasped together. We stand at the edge of our backyard, the wind rustling our hair, and begin our ritual. It's a quiet, intimate moment, just the two of us, connected to each other and to our shared past.

As we finish our ritual, I turn to Nico, my heart full. "You know, I think this is exactly what we needed."

Nico smiles, his eyes shining with love. "I knew you'd see it my way, Solace."

We share a soft kiss, the morning sun shining down on us. Our morning routine may have changed, but one thing remains the same: our love for each other, and our desire to start each day together.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
I settled onto the worn couch, running my fingers over the soft cushions as I waited for the pizza to cook. Will was in the kitchen, busy tossing a salad while the timer counted down. I pulled out my phone, scrolling through social media to pass the time. But my thumb wandered, and I found myself opening Will's phone instead. I'd told him before that I hated snooping, but he'd just laughed and said I could look through it anytime. I'd taken him at his word, but now I felt a twinge of guilt.

As I scrolled, I found myself in a sea of photos. There were pictures of our friends, our adventures, and our mundane daily life. But one album in particular caught my eye – a folder labeled "Nico's Special Moments." I raised an eyebrow, curiosity getting the better of me.

The first photo was of me making a silly face in the mirror, taken while we were getting ready for a party. I chuckled, remembering the ridiculous expression I'd made. The next photo was of me sleeping on the couch, a drool stain on my cheek. Will had captioned it "when Nico's had too much wine." I rolled my eyes, laughing.

But as I scrolled further, the photos started to get more and more poignant. There was one of me holding up a caught fish, beaming with pride, after our disastrous fishing trip. Another showed me sitting on the beach, watching the sunset, my eyes closed in bliss. I felt a warmth spread through my chest as I realized that Will had been capturing these moments – the ones I didn't even realize were special – all along.

I kept scrolling, my heart swelling with emotion. There was a photo of me reading a book on the couch, with a cup of coffee and a look of pure joy on my face. Will had captioned it "when Nico's in his happy place." I felt a lump form in my throat as I realized that he'd been paying attention to me – really paying attention – all along.

I closed the phone, my eyes welling up with tears. Will walked into the room, a smile on his face, and handed me a slice of pizza. "Hey, I saw you looking at my phone," he said, his eyes sparkling with amusement. I nodded, feeling a little sheepish. "I'm sorry," I said, taking a bite of the pizza. "I just...I didn't realize you'd been taking all these photos of me."

Will sat down beside me, putting his arm around my shoulders. "I wanted to capture the moments that make you happy," he said, his voice soft. "You're always making me laugh, and I wanted to remember that."

I turned to him, my eyes shining with tears. "You're always capturing the moments that make me happy," I said, my voice barely above a whisper. "You see me in a way that no one else does."

Will smiled, pulling me into a hug. "That's because I love you, Nico," he said, his voice full of emotion. "And I want to remember every moment we share together."

I held him tight, feeling grateful for this man who saw me in all my quirks and flaws, and loved me anyway. As we hugged, I knew that I'd treasure these photos – and the love that went into taking them – forever.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story: As I leaned against the doorway, watching Will scribble on a piece of paper, I couldn't help but tease him. "Come on, baby, just do one video for me. It'll be fun, I promise." I grinned mischievously, knowing full well how much he hated being in front of the camera. Will looked up from his drawing, his eyes narrowing at me. "Why do you need me to star in a video?" he asked, his voice laced with skepticism. I shrugged, trying to look as innocent as possible. "I just want to share my talents with the world, that's all. And I need a model to show off my makeup skills." Will snorted, rolling his eyes. "You're a makeup artist, not a celebrity. Just do your own video." I pouted, trying to look pitiful. "But it won't be the same without you. Besides, I promise you'll love it. I'll make you look like a demigod." Will's eyes widened at that, and for a moment, I thought I'd won him over. But then he shook his head. "No way. I'm not getting my face painted like a Greek god." I sighed dramatically, pretending to be heartbroken. "Fine, be that way. But I'm still going to make you do it." Will raised an eyebrow, but I could see the hint of a smile playing on his lips. "You're not exactly the most subtle person, you know that?" I grinned, triumphant. "Hey, it works, doesn't it?" I pulled him into the makeup room, surrounded by colorful palettes and quirky decor. Will settled into the chair, looking resigned. I winked at him, starting to work my magic. At first, it was just a typical makeup session - foundation, concealer, eyeshadow. But as I worked, my hands began to move with a life of their own. I added a dash of glitter, a sprinkle of stardust, and before I knew it, Will's eyes were shining like the stars in the night sky. His hair transformed into a wild tangle of golden locks, and his skin took on a radiant glow. I stepped back, admiring my handiwork. Will looked...well, not exactly like a demigod, but more like a mythical creature from a fantasy novel. His eyes widened as he took in his reflection. "What...what have you done?" he stammered. I grinned, trying to contain my laughter. "I told you it would be fun!" Will looked horrified, but I could see the hint of a smile playing on his lips. "You've turned me into a satyr," he accused. I shrugged, still chuckling. "Well, you do have a bit of a wild streak." Will shook his head, laughing despite himself. "You're impossible, you know that?" I grinned, hugging him tightly. "That's why you love me, right?"

writing_prompt: While navigating the Labyrinth, Nico encounters a strange, freckled boy claiming to be from the future—and his future boyfriend.
story:
The cold stone walls echoed with whispers of the past as I navigated the twisting paths of the Labyrinth. My eyes scanned the ancient stones, memorizing the turns and dead ends that led me deeper into the maze. My fingers absently drummed against the hilt of my dagger, a habit I'd developed over countless hours spent in this place.

My destination was the Labyrinth's center, where the Oracle of Delphi was said to reside. I'd been tasked with retrieving a crucial prophecy, one that could tip the balance of power in the war against Gaea. My heart wasn't in it, but duty called, and I answered.

As I turned a corner, I spotted a figure perched on a nearby rock, staring at a small device in his hand. His eyes were fixed on the screen, a look of intense concentration etched on his face. I halted, intrigued by the stranger's presence in the Labyrinth.

He looked up, noticing me for the first time. His eyes widened, and he jumped off the rock, nearly colliding with me. "Whoa, sorry about that!" he exclaimed, his freckled face flushed with embarrassment.

I raised an eyebrow, taken aback by his casual demeanor. "You're... not from around here, are you?" I asked, my tone a mix of curiosity and wariness.

The boy chuckled, his eyes sparkling with amusement. "Nope, I'm from the future. Or, at least, I'm from a future where I'm not stuck in a magical maze with a bunch of angry monsters."

I blinked, taken aback by his claim. "A future... boyfriend?" I repeated, my voice laced with skepticism.

The boy grinned, his teeth flashing in the dim light. "Yeah, that's me. You're Nico, right? I've read all about you in my history books."

My eyes narrowed, unsure how to process this strange encounter. "What's your name, and how did you get here?"

"I'm... uh... let's just say I'm a time-traveling historian, and I've been sent to observe and learn from you, Nico. Specifically, I'm here to see how you interact with your future boyfriend."

I raised an eyebrow, intrigued despite myself. "And what makes you think I have a boyfriend?"

The boy shrugged, his freckled face looking endearingly sheepish. "I've seen the future, Nico. I know all about you and Will Solace. You two are going to be amazing together, by the way."

I felt a strange sensation in my chest, a fluttering that had nothing to do with the monsters lurking in the Labyrinth's depths. "Will Solace?" I repeated, my voice barely above a whisper.

The boy nodded enthusiastically. "Yeah, that's the one! He's a great guy, and I'm sure you two will have a wonderful time together. I've even got some advice for you, if you want it."

I hesitated, unsure how to respond. Part of me was intrigued by this strange boy's claims, but another part of me was wary of getting tangled in his time-traveling web.

But there was something about him, something that made me want to trust him. Maybe it was the way he smiled, or the way his eyes sparkled when he talked about the future. Whatever it was, I found myself nodding, a small smile spreading across my face.

"Okay, future boy," I said, my voice a little softer than before. "I'll take your advice. But first, tell me more about this Will Solace. What's he like?"

The boy grinned, launching into a enthusiastic tale about my future boyfriend, one that left me smiling and feeling a little more hopeful about the future. As we talked, I realized that maybe, just maybe, this strange encounter in the Labyrinth was exactly what I needed.

writing_prompt: After surviving the horrors of Tartarus, Will and Nico have developed quiet rituals to soothe their lingering fears. One sleepless night, they find themselves dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of their shared past fades into the rhythm of the present.
story:
I lay awake, staring at the ceiling as the clock in the kitchen ticked away with an unsettling rhythm. Every tick felt like a heartbeat, reminding me of the countless ones I'd lost in Tartarus. I wasn't alone; I could sense Nico's restlessness beside me. His breathing was shallow, and I knew he was wide awake, just like me.

The darkness outside seemed to press in on us, but we didn't need to go anywhere to find our own personal hell. It was in the shadows, the creaks and groans of the old house, and the memories that lingered in every corner. I felt Nico's hand wrap around mine, and I squeezed it tight.

"Hey," he whispered, his voice barely audible over the hum of the refrigerator. "Want to dance?"

I raised an eyebrow, but he just smiled and tugged me out of bed. We stumbled into the kitchen, the soft glow of the light above the counter casting gentle shadows on the walls. The room was small, but it was ours, a sanctuary from the horrors we'd faced.

We moved to the center of the room, our feet swaying to the beat of the song playing on the radio – some obscure indie band that we both loved. The music was soothing, a gentle balm for our frazzled nerves. I wrapped my arms around Nico's waist, and he leaned into me, his head resting on my shoulder.

As we danced, the shadows in the kitchen seemed to fade away, replaced by the warmth of our bodies and the music. It was like we were in our own little world, one where the darkness outside didn't exist. Nico's hands slipped down to my hips, and he pulled me close, our bodies swaying in perfect sync.

For a moment, I forgot about Tartarus, forgot about the monsters and the pain. All that mattered was the man in my arms, the way his chest rose and fell with every breath, and the gentle smile on his face.

Nico's voice whispered in my ear, "Remember when we thought we'd never see the stars again?" I chuckled, feeling a lump form in my throat. "Yeah, I remember."

We danced on, lost in the rhythm of the music and the beat of our hearts. The clock in the kitchen continued to tick away, but it was just background noise now, a reminder of the present moment. We were alive, we were together, and we were healing.

As the song came to an end, Nico leaned back and looked up at me, his eyes shining with a quiet intensity. "You know, I never thought I'd say this, but I think our kitchen dance floor might be the safest place we've ever been."

I smiled, feeling a sense of peace wash over me. "I know exactly what you mean."

We stood there for a moment, our arms still wrapped around each other, the music lingering in the air. Then, without another word, we started to sway again, lost in the rhythm of our own little world.
